main event: On July 13, 1949, in Pullman, Washington, four witnesses sighted three unknown objects described as disc-shaped, about 10ft in diameter, flying in formation and exhibiting unconventional flight characteristics.
interesting points: The objects were black on top and silver-colored on the bottom, with no smoke, trails, exhaust, or sound observed.
The objects continued in flight after making a 90-degree turn until they disappeared from view.
Positive identification of the objects was not possible, and no evidence of propulsion or control surfaces was noted.
The objects were estimated to be in sight for 5-8 minutes, and their flight path included oscillating and brisk swinging movements.
Four B-29s were known to be in or near the area at the time of the sighting.
